remarks: Two subspaces with trivial intersection have a unique decomposition of the elements of the subspace sum.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
shuni.1 $e |- ( ph -> H e. SH ) $.
shuni.2 $e |- ( ph -> K e. SH ) $.
shuni.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( H i^i K ) = 0H ) $.
shuni.4 $e |- ( ph -> A e. H ) $.
shuni.5 $e |- ( ph -> B e. K ) $.
shuni.6 $e |- ( ph -> C e. H ) $.
shuni.7 $e |- ( ph -> D e. K ) $.
shuni.8 $e |- ( ph -> ( A +h B ) = ( C +h D ) ) $.
shuni $p |- ( ph -> ( A = C /\ B = D ) ) $.
